last_episode_to_air.name: They Shoot Crocodiles Don't They
last_episode_to_air.overview: Steve gives the viewers a look at the seven cameramen who have captured his encounters with wildlife throughout the years.

name: The Crocodile Hunter
overview: The Crocodile Hunter is a wildlife documentary television series that was hosted by Steve Irwin and his wife Terri. The show became a popular franchise due to its unconventional approach and Irwin's approach to wildlife. It spawned a number of separate projects, including the feature film The Crocodile Hunter: Collision Course and two television spinoffs: The Crocodile Hunter Diaries and Croc Files. The series has been presented on Animal Planet and has been in international syndication on networks worldwide.

episodes.name: Wild in the USA
episodes.overview: Steve follows Terri to her home state of Oregon, and to New York, to watch beavers and raccoons. Steve also helps Terri to relocate her pet cougar, Malina. Animals are alligator snapping turtle, American alligator, grey kangaroo, freshwater crocodile and red-belly black snake.

episodes.name: Dinosaurs Down Under
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri trace the history of Australia's dinosaurs.

episodes.name: Sleeping with Crocodiles
episodes.overview: Steve takes viewers behind the scenes at the Queensland Reptile and Fauna Park (now Australia Zoo) in Australia. The work at the park includes relocation of giant boas and healthcare for alligators.

episodes.name: Suburban Killers
episodes.overview: Not all dangerous creatures live out in the wilderness of the forests, the jungles and the Outback. Some of them live in the homes of suburbanites in Australia. Steve examines some of the venomous snakes and spiders that can make unwelcome appearances in suburbia.

episodes.name: Dangerous Animals
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri venture across the United States of America, seeking out deadly scorpions, venomous snakes and toxic spiders.

episodes.name: Traveling the Dingo Fence
episodes.overview:
The Dingo Fence in southern Queensland, is part of the world's longest fence (over 3300 miles long), built to keep dingoes out of southern Queensland and away from the sheep flocks. Steve observes boars, snakes and dingoes in the Outback.

Note: This episode originally aired as a two-hour special, but in later reruns, it was divided into two separate episodes.

episodes.name: Hidden River
episodes.overview: Steve attempts to rescue a turtle in a river despite the presence of crocodiles.

episodes.name: Elephants and Orange People
episodes.overview: Steve encounters orangutans and elephants in Sumatra.

episodes.name: Suburban Killers
episodes.overview: Poisonous snakes and spiders infest suburban homes in Australia.

episodes.name: Hidden River
episodes.overview: Steve dives into a crocodile-infested river to catch a turtle.

episodes.name: Steve and the Dragon
episodes.overview: Steve comes face to face with a Komodo Dragon, the world's largest lizard, on a remote Indonesian island.

episodes.name: Return to the Wild
episodes.overview: Steve returns to his roots as he captures and relocates a 14-foot crocodile named Nobby away from a busy waterway in Australia.

episodes.name: Outlaws of the Outback: Part 1
episodes.overview: Steve takes a look at the serious problem of the introduction of non-native species to Australia. The new species can crowd out the native animals. In Australia, the vast majority of animals are endemic to the continent. Steve also shows a roundup of wild camels.

episodes.name: Outlaws of the Outback: Part 2
episodes.overview: Steve continues his examination of non-indigenous animal species that threaten to crowd out native Australian animals.

episodes.name: Island of Time
episodes.overview: Beautiful scenery and adventure are encountered during Steve and Terri's visit to the isolated inhabitants of the world's largest sand island.

episodes.name: Reptiles of the Deep: Turtles
episodes.overview: Green and loggerhead sea turtles lay their eggs on the land. The hatchlings face enormous obstacles to get to the ocean. Steve films the struggle and shows an annual scientific survey of the turtles off the east coast of Australia.

episodes.name: Where the Devils Run Wild
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri seek the Tasmanian tiger, thought to be extinct since the 1930s, as well as Tasmanian devils, copperhead snakes, black-faced shags, pademelon joeys and wombats.

episodes.name: Last Waterholes of the Outback
episodes.overview: Steve travels to the Australian Outback to show us the last remaining major sources of water in this dry area. Animals are saltwater crocodile, freshwater crocodile, brown tree snake, tick, frill neck lizard, cattle and kangaroo.

episodes.name: The Crocodile Hunter Goes West
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri travel west in search of a mate for the Goanna lizards at the reptile park. Also: the pair rappel into a deep bush gorge, but have difficulty trying to get out.

episodes.name: Freshwater Crocs
episodes.overview: Steve gives viewers a look at freshwater crocodiles.

episodes.name: Sharks Outside the Cage
episodes.overview: Steve studies some of the more placid and harmless sharks living in the waters around Australia.

episodes.name: Legends of the Galapagos
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri study the Galapagos on their 168-year-old tortoise's birthday.

episodes.name: America's Deadliest Snakes
episodes.overview: Steve travels to the United States where he researches the remarkable rattlesnakes, the most venomous serpents of all, to show how placid they can be when unprovoked. In Florida, he finds snakes as diverse as the pygmy rattler and eastern diamondbacks. He also has a close encounter with timber rattlers in Virginia.

episodes.name: Reptiles of the Deep: Sea Snakes
episodes.overview: Steve films the deadly sea snake in its underwater environment.

episodes.name: Reptiles of the Deep: Saurians
episodes.overview: Reptiles still living in the sea include saltwater crocodiles and lizards that can dive deep.

episodes.name: Steve and the Dragon
episodes.overview: Steve ventures to the remote part of the Indonesian islands to observe the largest lizard in the world, the Komodo dragon. Animals are Komodo dragon, gecko, golden tree snake, monkey, water buffalo, Russell's viper, and orange-footed scrubfowl.

episodes.name: Australia's Wild Frontier
episodes.overview: Steve travels to Queensland's Cape York, which is considered one of the last wild frontiers of Australia.

episodes.name: Faces in the Forest
episodes.overview: Falling in love with the orangutans of Sumatra, Steve assists them in their rehabilitation process.

episodes.name: Steve's Story
episodes.overview: Interviews with Steve, Terri, his father Bob, his mother Lyn, and some of his friends, as they reveal the man behind the adventure series.

episodes.name: Steve's Most Dangerous Adventures
episodes.overview: Steve looks back on his most dangerous encounters, including those with Komodo dragons, various crocodiles and venomous snakes.

episodes.name: Steve's Greatest Crocodile Captures
episodes.overview: Steve's greatest crocodile captures are shown in this episode. Steve and Terri also review the proper methods to use in such captures.

episodes.name: Wild River of Africa
episodes.overview: The Luangwa River in Zambia includes hippoes, Nile crocodiles and monitor lizards among its residents. Steve witnesses a crocodile feeding frenzy.

episodes.name: A Handful of Elephants
episodes.overview: Steve tracks wild elephants in Sumatra, crocodiles, water monitors and wild boars.cess.

episodes.name: Jungle in the Clouds
episodes.overview: Steve journeys through the wilderness of New Guinea, moving through the mangroves of the coast, jungles on the lowland plains, valleys, and mountains toward his destination: a rare equatorial glacier. He examines wildlife large and small all along his route.

episodes.name: Wildest Baby Animal Videos
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri visit the small, cute and entertaining world of baby animals, including possums, bears, snakes, bison, crocs and tigers.

episodes.name: Wildlife in Combat (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri help U.S. Army Rangers to remove venomous snakes out of harm's way from a training course at Eglin Air Force Base in Florida.

episodes.name: Forces of Nature (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Visiting U.S. armed forces at Eglin Air Force Base, Steve gets to ride in Air Force jets. Then, he and Terri visit the Everglades in South Florida.

episodes.name: Sidewinders of Arizona
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri visit the Barry M. Goldwater Military Range in Arizona to track down the sidewinder rattlesnake. Afterward, Steve visits the airmen at Luke Air Force Base, who prove to be fans of his show. Steve gets the opportunity to fly in an F-16, the plane that carries the sidewinder missile named after the rattlesnake.

episodes.name: Captured on Camera
episodes.overview: A compilation of the best moments of the series up to this point.

episodes.name: Crocodiles of the Revolution
episodes.overview: Steve joins the Australian Zoo team and World Society for the Protection of Animals on a wildlife rescue mission to remove crocodiles from a zoo in war-torn East Timor.

episodes.name: Journey to the Red Center
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri journey to the Red Desert at the heart of Australia. They examine venomous snakes, lizards and endangered mammals as they make their way to the world famous Uluru, also known as Ayers Rock.

episodes.name: Africa's Deadliest Snake
episodes.overview: Steve journeys to Kenya in search of some of Africa's most venomous snakes, including the black mamba and cobra.

episodes.name: Wildest Home Videos
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri show us their home video collection, most of which document their conservation work.

episodes.name: Big Croc Diaries
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri show off their favorite crocodiles at Australia Zoo. The action includes shots of the biggest crocodiles eating pigs whole. High-speed film techniques highlight the power of the mighty creatures.

episodes.name: Swimming with Alligators
episodes.overview: A missile-test site is the home of alligators. Steve also examines snakes in Louisiana and water moccasins.

episodes.name: Surfing Snakes
episodes.overview: Steve heads to Indonesia where he looks at venomous snakes, lizards and monkeys.odiles.

episodes.name: Last Primates of Madagascar (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Steve attempts to find members of the four remaining lemur species on the island of Madagascar. He travels through the countryside on bicycle and talks with the town inhabitants.

episodes.name: Reptiles of the Lost Continent (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Steve looks at cave-dwelling crocodiles, different types of chameleon and other unusual reptiles on Madagascar.

episodes.name: Spitting Cobras of the World
episodes.overview: Steve encounters spitting cobras, snakes that send venom into the eyes of their victims from up to 6 feet away. Despite wearing safety goggles, Steve must seek out medical assistance at a Maasai village after he is sprayed with the venom.

episodes.name: Dangerous Africans
episodes.overview: Steve encounters charging elephants on an African safari. He observes snakes, scorpions, buffalo, spiders and lions, and avoids a pursuing hippo.

episodes.name: Wild Surf of Indonesia
episodes.overview: Steve travels to Indonesia to encounter wildlife, then hits the beach to do some surfing.

episodes.name: Operation Steve
episodes.overview: Steve undergoes knee surgery.

episodes.name: Operation: Bunya Rescue
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri relocate the animals of a bankrupt zoo, including koalas, kangaroos, crocodiles, birds, and a wombat.

episodes.name: Africa's Final Frontier
episodes.overview: Steve visits the wilderness of Namibia in southern Africa.

episodes.name: Graham's Revenge
episodes.overview: Steve and the team at Australia Zoo successfully transfer the ornery crocodile Graham and his girlfriend Bindi to a new enclosure. Not long after, Steve and Wes Mannion have to enter the enclosure. Graham gets his revenge by attacking Wes. Steve saves the day by jumping on Graham, although Wes suffers severe injuries.

episodes.name: From the Outback to Hollywood
episodes.overview: A detailed account of Steve and Terri Irwin's sudden and unexpected rise to fame, in just one short decade. Footage includes the whirlwind of a promotional tour for their first Hollywood film, and their conservation work at the Australia Zoo.

episodes.name: Casper: The White Crocodile
episodes.overview: Steve relocates an extremely ornery white crocodile named Casper.

episodes.name: Whale Sharks of the Wild West (Part 1)
episodes.overview: Steve enters the water to look at dolphins, seals and sharks. He also takes time to look at the wreck of the Batavia and see tammar wallabies and pythons.

episodes.name: Crocodile Coast (Part 2)
episodes.overview: Steve looks at the crocodiles, sharks and sea snakes in the Kimberley region coastal area of Western Australia.

episodes.name: River of the Dammed
episodes.overview: Steve is the special guest of the Belize Zoo as they celebrate their 20th anniversary. He also travels up the Macal River to observe a controversial dam project and tangles with a highly venomous fer-de-lance snake while searching for Morelet crocodiles.

episodes.name: They Shoot Crocodiles, Don't They?
episodes.overview: Steve gives the viewers a look at the seven cameramen who have captured his encounters with wildlife over the years.

episodes.name: Search for a Super Croc
episodes.overview: Steve and the crocodile capture team take journey to the remote part of Queensland to find large saltwater crocodiles.

episodes.name: Crocs in the City
episodes.overview: Steve Irwin works with the Mexican government to solve croc problems in the resort towns of Tampico and Cancún.

episodes.name: Island of Snakes
episodes.overview: Steve Irwin travels to Sri Lanka to help laborers contend with some of the most venomous snakes in the world like the Russell's vipers and the cobras. And, for the first time in his life, he goes head-to-head with a man-eating mugger crocodile.

episodes.name: Tigers of Shark Bay
episodes.overview: Steve observes the tiger sharks of Western Australia's Shark Bay. He helps to release a captive tiger shark back into the wild, and he hand feeds bull sharks.

episodes.name: Ice Breaker
episodes.overview: Steve and his camera crew look at the wildlife of Antarctica, including penguins, leopard seals, humpback whales and elephant seals.

episodes.name: Confessions of the Crocodile Hunter
episodes.overview: This episode takes a look at the accomplishments of Steve and Terri Irwin. The infamous "Baby Bob incident" is explored in detail as Steve and Terri explain the events of that day.

episodes.name: Africa's Final Frontier
episodes.overview: Steve travels to Namibia, where he experiences close encounters with a variety of dangerous animals and plants, including a tree with inch-long poisonous spines, a feisty viper and a cranky cobra.

episodes.name: Lights! Croc! Action!
episodes.overview: A very unusual behind the scenes look at the making of Steve's first feature film "The Crocodile Hunter: Collision Course".

episodes.name: Ghosts of War (Part 1)
episodes.overview: In this epic two-part mini-series, Steve revisits some of the notorious and legendary battle grounds of the Pacific conflict between the Allied forces and Japan.

episodes.name: Ghosts of War (Part 2)
episodes.overview: In this epic two-part mini-series, Steve revisits some of the notorious and legendary battle grounds of the Pacific conflict between the Allied forces and Japan. Part 2 of 2

episodes.name: Up Over Down Under
episodes.overview: Steve, wife Terri and daughter Bindi travel from Brisbane to Broome in an old DC-3 airplane.

episodes.name: Steve's Dream
episodes.overview: Construction at the zoo means moving the residents, so snakes, alligators, crocodiles and lizards must be relocated. Also: a two-headed snake gets Brendan's attention; and Kelsey puts in her notice.

episodes.name: Croc Hunter Live
episodes.overview: The team attempts to relocate a crocodile named Monty at the Australia Zoo. The animal is so big it must be airlifted from one side of the zoo to the other.

episodes.name: Casper: The White Crocodile
episodes.overview: Eleven crocodiles must be relocated at the zoo, so Steve develops a new method to capture them. Also: a white crocodile is introduced at the zoo and proves to be aggressive towards a female.

episodes.name: Crocodile Coast
episodes.overview: A helicopter trip along Australia's Kimberly Coast includes crocodile encounters. Also: reef diving among sea snakes and sharks.

episodes.name: River of the Damned
episodes.overview: Steve is the special guest of the Belize Zoo as they celebrate their 20th anniversary. He also travels up the Macal river to observe a controversial dam project; and tangles with a highly poisonous fer de lance snake while searching for Morelet crocodiles.

episodes.name: Australia's Wild Frontier
episodes.overview: Steve and Terri venture out to Cape York in Queensland, Australia, one of the most remote areas in the country. Among the creatures they spot are the Scrub Python, the Slately Grey Snake, feral pigs, a Rusty Monitor Goanna and the tree-jumping Canopy Goanna, the rarest goanna species in the world.

episodes.name: Whale Sharks of the Wild West
episodes.overview: Steve, Terri and Bindi sail along the west coast of Australia in a luxury cruiser. Included: swimming with dolphins, seals and sharks. Also, a trip inland to observe wallabies and pythons.

episodes.name: Search for a Super Croc
episodes.overview: A look at the 60 million year history of the crocodile.

episodes.name: Crocs in the City
episodes.overview: Steve Irwin works with the Mexican government to solve croc problems in the resort towns of Tampico and Cancun.

episodes.name: Tigers of Shark Bay
episodes.overview: Steve observes the tiger sharks of Western Australia's Shark Bay. He helps to release a captive tiger shark back into the wild, and he hand feeds bull sharks.

episodes.name: Ice Breaker
episodes.overview: Steve looks at the wildlife of Antarctica, including penguins, leopard seals and humpback whales.

episodes.name: Confessions of the Crocodile Hunter
episodes.overview: This episode takes a look at the accomplishments of Steve and Terri Irwin. The infamous "Baby Bob incident" is explored in detail as Steve and Terri explain the events of that day.

episodes.name: They Shoot Crocodiles Don't They
episodes.overview: Steve gives the viewers a look at the seven cameramen who have captured his encounters with wildlife throughout the years.
